reviewText: Gene Autry Collection 12 has 4 more of Gene Autrys best of his movies and they are all restored and uncut you will enjoy these movies its Gene Autry at his best.

Shout Factory has just announced the release of Collection 12 in this series. Once again, Smiley Burnette is the sidekick in all these movies.

Gene Autry (September 29, 1907 - October 2, 1998) appeared in 93 films and 91 episodes of The Gene Autry Show television series from 1934 to 1953. Autry was also one of the most important figures in the history of country music. During World War II Autry enlisted in the United States Army in 1942 and became a tech sergeant in the United States Army Air Corps. Autry retired from show business in 1964, having made almost 100 films up to 1955 and over 600 records, Melody Ranch burned down in 1962, dashing Autry's plans to turn it into a museum. Gene Autry died of lymphoma on October 2, 1998, aged 91 at his home in Studio City, California

The 4 movies this time are as follows

Sagebrush Troubadour (1935)

Before he was murdered Grandpa Martin found a gold mine. He failed to record it and now everyone is looking for Martin's old horse that can lead them to it. When Autry arrives to investigate, he is accused of the murder and finds the Sheriff after him.

 Ride, Ranger, Ride (1936)

  Gene is a Texas Ranger working under cover to protect an Army wagon train full of ammunition and supplies. The Army doesn't believe him at first, until the Commanches arrive.

 Yodelin' Kid from Pine Ridge (1937)

Parker steals cattle from the cattlemen and blames it on the turpentiners. Then he incites the cattlemen to burn down the turpentiners trees. When Gene finds the rustled cattle he tries to kill him. Failing, he kills both Gene's father and Bayliss Baynam and has Gene arrested for Baynum's murder.

 Goldmine in the Sky (1938)

In his will Langham leaves his ranch to his daughter Cody but makes Gene the executor. When Gene refuses to let her marry Cummings, Cummings tries to have Gene killed. Cummings now demands money and Cody stages a fake kidnaping to raise it. But the plan backfires when Cummings learns of the hoax and turns it into a real kidnaping.

Our grandsons loved the story lines and Gene Autry the cowboy but they asked why all the singing? lol  It's a new generation.... I told them that he was the first to sing "Rudolph the Red Nosed Reindeer" and that impressed them....
Although these claim to be uncut 'Ride Ranger Ride' is the 54 minute version (originally 63 minutes) with several songs cut out.

What can I say? I'm addicted to B Westerns and Gene made some of the best, mainly those from Republic Pictures. Some of the Columbia's are fine, some not. The four in this set are all early Republic's and a lot of fun...if you're not looking for cinema classics. But, of course, there are those of us who DO consider these classics. Grab a bowl of popcorn, sit back and for a short time enjoy programmers made for a simpler time. Just one man's opinion. *sigh*
This is a must too buy, I have most off Gene Autrys movies and TV shows thir great.
Everything I wanted. Service from this seller is excellent.
Exactly as expected. Love these movies and extras!
